discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/10_0_1/ccmcfg/CUCM_BK_C95ABA82_00_admin-guide-100/CUCM_BK_C95ABA82_00_admin-guide-100_chapter_01010001.html

Selected Answer: D
To ensure that SIP phones always try to set up Early Offer calls and display Fully Qualified Domain Names (FQDNs) in SIP URIs called or received, these options are typically configured in:

D. SIP Profile settings.

SIP Profiles in Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM) contain settings and configurations related to SIP communication parameters. Options such as setting up Early Offer calls and specifying how SIP URIs are displayed would be configured within the SIP Profile associated with the SIP phones.

Selected Answer: D
Is the correct answer

questions.question_text: The engineer must ensure that the new SIP phones always try to set up Early Offer calls and display Fully Qualified Domain Names in SIP URIs called or received. Where are these options configured?

choices.A: Phone Device settings. Protocol Specific Information section
choices.C: Phone Device settings. Model Specific Information section

questions.question_text: SNMP notifications send traps immediately if the corresponding trap flags are enabled. Which two messages are Cisco UCM SNMP trap/inform messages? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
The following list contains Unified Communications Manager SNMP trap/inform messages that are sent to a configured trap destination:

Unified Communications Manager failed
Phone failed
Phones status update
Gateway failed
Media resource list exhausted
Route list exhausted
Gateway layer 2 change
Quality report
Malicious call
Syslog message generated

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/12_5_1SU1/adminGd/cucm_b_administration-guide-1251SU1/cucm_b_test-adminguide_chapter_010110.html#CUCM_RF_S25B9A49_00

Selected Answer: AB
The following list contains Cisco Unified CM SNMP trap and inform messages that are sent to a configured trap destination:

Cisco Unified CM failed
Phone failed
Phones status update
Gateway failed
Media resource list exhausted
Route list exhausted
Gateway layer 2 change
Quality report
Malicious call
Syslog message generated

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/service/10_0_1/rtmt/CUCM_BK_C8A0AF97_00_cucm-managed-service-guide-100/CUCM_BK_C8A0AF97_00_cucm-managed-service-guide-100_chapter_011.html#CUCM_RF_SC617A35_00

Selected Answer: C
it seems the term "self-contained" describes the Token. However the format or standard is JWT. I think it is C. the most specific.
Unfortunately, both C and D correct Because JSON WeB tOKEB IS A Self-contained Token

from: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/jabber/215572-cisco-jabber-and-sip-oauth-mode.html#anc2
we find this (Under Key benefits)
SIP OAuth mode allows Cisco Jabber Softphone to use OAuth self-describing tokens instead of client LSC certificate for authentication on secure SIP interface.
So Answer is D

comments.content:
from: https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/jabber/11_9/Unified-CM-OAuth-Whitepaper-v17-FINAL.pdf
we found this:
The tokens are self-contained, meaning that the UC service trusts tokens it can open and validate without communicating with the OAuth server. Tokens use the RFC-based JSON Web Token (JWT) format.

I changed my last comment. ANSWER is C

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
According to the document: "Administration Guide for Cisco Unified Communications Manager, Release 12.5(1)SU1", Chapter "Simple Network Management Protocol", section "SNMP V3 User Configuration Settings", correct answer is C.

questions.question_text: Which action is needed to configure ReadOnly SNMPv3 on a Cisco UCM cluster?

choices.A: Define an SNMP user with ReadOnly access privilege on the publisher node only.
choices.D: Define an SNMP community string with ReadOnly access privilege on the publisher node only.
choices.B: Define an SNMP community string with ReadOnly access privilege on all nodes in the cluster.
choices.C: Define an SNMP user with ReadOnly access privilege and apply to all nodes in cluster.

questions.question_text: An engineer is designing a load balancing solution for two Cisco Unified Border Element routers. The first router (cube1.ab◊Å.com) takes 60% of the calls and the second router (cube2.abc.com) takes 40% of the calls. Assume all DNS A records have been created. Which two SRV records are needed for a load balanced solution? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
C,E are correct:
- Service: The symbolic name of the desired service
 - Proto: The transport protocol of the desired service; this is usually either Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) or User Datagram Protocol (UDP)
 - Name: The domain name for which this record is valid, it ends in a dot
 - TTL: Standard DNS time to live field
 - Class: Standard DNS class field (this is always IN)
 - Priority: The priority of the target host, lower value means more preferred
 - Weight: A relative weight for records with the same priority, higher value means more preferred
 - Port: The TCP or UDP port on which the service is to be found
 - Target: The canonical hostname of the machine that provides the service, it ends in a dot

Same priority and diferent weight

Selected Answer: CE
C and E - correct - load balancing means same priority so both have number 1

CE
These answers are trying to be confusing by making the TTL field "60" only the number right before the port (5060) matters for weight
